abstract: New York State Appeals Court rules caretaker who is neither related to nor adoptive guardian of child may ask for custody and visitation rights; decision, which expands definition of parenthood in manner particularly relevant to same-sex couples, springs from dispute between gay couple known as Brook S B and Elizabeth A C C.

headline.print_headline: New York Court Expands  Definition of Parenthood
headline.main: New York’s Highest Court Expands Definition of Parenthood

snippet: The State Court of Appeals ruled that a nonadoptive, nonbiological caretaker of a child could be allowed to ask for custody and visitation rights....
lead_paragraph: The State Court of Appeals ruled that a nonadoptive, nonbiological caretaker of a child could be allowed to ask for custody and visitation rights.
